main event: A single, bright object was observed descending rapidly in the northwest sky over St. Paul, Minnesota on January 30, 1962.
interesting points: The object was witnessed by many individuals, both on the ground and in the air.
The object possessed no distinctive characteristics and did not pose a threat to national security.
The object appeared to suddenly stop, hover briefly, then accelerate rapidly and disappear from view.
The observer estimated the object's size to be around 2-3 feet in diameter and covered about 1/8 of a matchstick held at arm's length.
The object's appearance and behavior, such as changing brightness and direction, were described as similar to a bright meteor or large, reflective object.
